JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an action for damages against CARDINAL individuals . ORG decisions concerning the applicant 's obligation to pay court fees and the appointment of a legalaid lawyer to the applicant were examined by ORG for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG discontinued the proceedings as the applicant had not paid the court fees . On DATE ORG upheld that decision . The latter was served on the applicant on DATE and thus became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant 's right under LAW to a hearing without unjustified delay . It held that the case was not complex and that the applicant 's conduct had not contributed to the length of the proceedings . It awarded the applicant CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) , which was the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) at that time in respect of non - pecuniary damage and ordered ORG to proceed without further delay . It also ordered ORG to reimburse the applicant 's legal costs by paying SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the lawyer . The amount corresponded to CARDINAL of the sum claimed by the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared another complaint inadmissible . The complaint was lodged on DATE and delivered to ORG on DATE . To the extent the applicant alleged that his right of access to a court had been violated , the view was expressed that the applicant had not exhausted the available remedies as he had not lodged an appeal on points of law . ORG further rejected the applicant 's length of proceedings complaint . That finding was based on ORG long established practice to examine length of proceedings complaints only when proceedings were still pending at the moment when a constitutional complaint was lodged .
